abstract: Weather forecasters and atmospheric scientists say they were not wrong to warn that massive snow storm would hit New York City; defend computer models used and point out that hard-hit areas were often only few miles from those that were only dusted with snow.
lead_paragraph: Meteorologists said their computer models correctly predicted a major snowfall in the Northeast, but it intensified 50 to 100 miles farther east than expected, mostly sparing New York City.
snippet: Meteorologists said their computer models correctly predicted a major snowfall in the Northeast, but it intensified 50 to 100 miles farther east than expected, mostly sparing New York City.

headline.main: Snowstorm’s Forecast Was Mostly Right, Even if It Felt Wrong in New York
headline.print_headline: Forecasting for Storm Was Not So Wrong
